file_content.text: Enough of this. I am a Dark Council member!
You do not have the strength, or the authority, to defeat me.
He's running away. That can't be a legal move.
He's escaping, the coward!
Master, he flees.
So the great Sith Lord's turned yellow, huh.
He leaves the grounds of the Kaggath. He brings dishonor and defeat on his head. He is yours to kill and mine to devour, master.
Thanaton flees the Kaggath! He forfeits!
My lord, Thanaton is escaping, but by fleeing he forfeits the Kaggath.
Then we will pursue him and strike him down.
He will not escape.
Do not let him escape this planet!
Stop him!
Does he really think he's safe anywhere in this galaxy?
Where is he going?
He's gone to seek the support of the Dark Council on Korriban. That was always his plan if this thing backfired.
Be careful, my lord. Thanaton will be among allies.
My lord, Lord Kirnon at your service. Thanaton ordered his servant to set a course for Korriban. He's fled to the Dark Council chambers.
He'll be among allies if he gets there. Tread carefully if you wish to defeat him.
I won the Kaggath fair and square. I must hope the Dark Council sees the justice of my cause.
To Korriban, then.
Dark Council or not, I can't let him get away.
I fear no one.
I've been waiting a long time to meet these Sith. I hope it's worth my while.
The Dark Council, finally.
Good luck, my lord.
Grow strong in the Force, my lord.
Sorry for fighting you earlier. Darth Thanaton's got some sort of strange pull, yeah?
Never mind that. I won't let Thanaton get away.
We'll discuss that later.
I'm sorry, my lord. Darth Thanaton's will was greater than my own.
It looks like it's just the two of us now, Thanaton.
Peace is a lie. There is only passion. Through passion, I gain strength. Through strength, power. Through power, victory!
Through victory, my chains are broken. The Force shall free me.
Don't forget the end.
I wish it hadn't come to this.
It has been an honor, Darth Thanaton. I'm sorry it has to end like this.
You're a worthy opponent.
As am I.
I can't wait to shut you up.
You die now.
So like Zash.
You must not live. It is the will of the Sith.
Impressive, but not enough.
Darth Kallous will teach you to bow.
Not bad. But you're running out of help.
Darth Achelon! Kill him.
Darth Achelon! Kill her.
No.
What?
This one saved my life. I will not repay him with bloodshed.
This one saved my life. I will not repay her with bloodshed.
Fine. Your principles are noble, if misplaced.
As for you, meet my personal guards. Each one of them a powerful cyborg.
Darth Kallous! Kill him.
Darth Kallous! Kill her.
With pleasure, my lord.
Go on. Kill your friend.
I knew you'd come around, Moff.
Yes, finally. Sith, Imperials. The challenger has arrived. The Kaggath ends here.
I've gathered you here to watch me wipe this degenerate from the face of the Empire.
He calls himself Sith, but he is slave to a corrupt master. Zash is now dead and all who served her must die as well.
She calls herself Sith, but she is slave to a corrupt master. Zash is now dead and all who served her must die as well.
Darth Thanaton says that my former master, Darth Zash, was corrupt.
Let's examine these charges.
But when he saw that my master was corrupt, did Darth Thanaton try to remove the corruption?
No. He left that task to me. So you tell me: Is it corrupt to remove the corrupter?
You made no attempt to hide your transgressions. You are as bad as she.
This Sith would see the traditions that have made our Empire great destroyed. She would rip up our foundations and collapse the glorious temple of the Empire brick by brick!
This Sith would see the traditions that have made our Empire great destroyed. He would rip up our foundations and collapse the glorious temple of the Empire brick by brick!
Are you free people or are you slaves?
Think for yourselves.
If you are slaves, by all means, let Thanaton and his kind intimidate you into mindless obedience.
But if you believe we are born to be masters of this galaxy, shout to deafen Thanaton and his kind--"I will not serve!"
Look where that attitude has gotten you!
The traditions of Sith society guide us in steering this great vessel, the Empire.
Change is for the better.
But times change. We find we need new equipment modeled on the old.
We must be willing to part with what is no longer useful, before we become weighted down by unnecessary machinery.
Weighted down? Is that what you consider your companions? Dead weight?
I think you'll find them less supportive now.
Weighted down? Is that what Moff Pyron was to you? Dead weight?
Let's see whether you fight as well as you talk, hmm?
Blah blah blah.
The Kaggath is a battle of esteem. Lightsabers will only get you so far.
Gaining friends is one thing, keeping them is another, isn't it?
Clearly I was mistaken about you, but Darth Thanaton is merciful.
This is it. Me and my supporters against you and yours. Let there be blood!
It's been too long, Thanaton.
My lord, you have my support, and I won't even charge you this time.
My lord, my finest soldiers are at your disposal.
You have your allies and I have mine. Now we'll see who's true Sith.
Enjoy fighting your friends.
Moff Pyron, get your men into position.
Ready yourselves, soldiers.
They're ready on your order, my lord.
Stand down, that's an order.
Do not attack!
They won't listen. They've all been persuaded quite thoroughly of the benefits of your death.
Moff Pyron, if you would do the honors.
Friends, be ready to fight.
Arm yourselves, allies.
Hmm.
Thanaton gives us no choice.
Fighting a Dark Council member isn't exactly what I signed up for, but a challenge is a challenge.
Always ready, my master.
You don't need to say it.
It doesn't matter how many allies you have.
Ready your lightsaber, Skar.
Lord Skar, prepare yourself.
With pleasure.
I hope you're ready for a fight.
Ready, Cineratus?
If I must.
It's going to take more effort than that to stop me.
You won't win.
We'll see, we'll see.
Moff Pyron, surely we can work this out.
I don't want to fight you.
You ruined your chance when you left our base at the mercy of Republic forces.
You've done well keeping your allies, but I have friends of my own.
How do you keep doing this? I can't win.
I surrender. Meet me at the Coronet City capitol. I will surrender the Kaggath publicly.
You, you are too canny.
Defense protocol six! Now. Now!
Of course, loyalty was never Skar's preference.
So I created a little insurance policy. I look forward to your next move.
Not bad, but not enough. Now everyone sees your weakness.
You've saved your fleet, but you've let the enemy slip from your grasp.
Well done, attacking my headquarters, but you'll get nowhere swinging at illusions.
Don't worry, I haven't killed your friends--yet. I think I'll be better served by their public execution.
Are you still trying to use that Force-walking shield?
What? Why didn't that work?
Well done. This round goes to you.
